comment: Best acct professor I have had so far. Easy to learn from and hw was available to work at your own pace quizzes every week and Exams were a little difficult but he helps you understand the concept in class. Wished he taught other accounting classes. Also reasonable with my health issues not like others.

Prof. Sadeckas was fantastic, and I enjoyed this class very much. He is very understanding with grading and a great professor overall. His tests are difficult, but he provides a study guide that encompasses all the content and math needed. The test grades are also very large, but grades from weekly assignments saturate it a good bit. Take him!

This class is is tough, but Professor Sadeckas offers extra credit and other opportunities for you to succeed. I recommend watching the videos at the beginning of each section, doing your homework, and studying the test reviews. If you do all that, you should be able to get a decent grade if not an A. He's a good professor. Very kind and helpful.

Not the best teacher but knows his stuff. Goes rather quickly at times and tends to over complicate things. A few weeks in I realized that the textbook videos at the beg. of each section were the best. I basically learned 90% of the material through those vids and passed the class with a 99 while most others were struggling. WATCH THE VIDEOS

I actually really liked him. He does practice problems in class to review the material. Attendance does count but there is just a sheet at the front of the room. He gives a study guide before each test and pulls 30 of the 50 study guide questions ( just changes some numbers) and he curves too. The homework kinda sucks but we made a study group.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: The material is tough and Professor Sadeckas isnt the nicest of guys but he gives a ton of extra credit, not the greatest accounting teacher but your not screwed

This class is tough.  Lectures tend to be very long.  He hands out a study guide a week before the exam.  I recommend you study it.  If you do your homework and practice the study guides before the exam you should get a B or higher.

Kenneth Sadeckas is the man! He is an awesome teacher who really cares about his students and wants them to learn.  His tests are not hard. 1 on paper with work and 2 on scantron which he gives you 100  test questions before on a study guide and only 40 are on the test but he gives you the exact questions. Lectures re off powerpoint and are boring.

He is so boring! 3 tests which he gives great study guide for.  weekly quizzes aren't bad. group projects are a bother.  and group paper is ridiculous.  He grades so harshly for group items.  He is really dull and attendance is part of grade.  He is so dry you will want to scream at how boring he is. He goes to fast and doesnt explain anything.

This dude is so boring!!He just sits there and clicks through the ppts aimlessly.  When it got to the math parts everyone was lost.  You have to study on your own.  Group projects weren't hard but they were a bother to do.  He does give great study guides 3tests.  And quizzes due every week,a group paper that he totally rips apart and grades harsh.

This professor likes to rush through examples. Does not give time for students to grasp content. Just shows you his Excel spreadsheet and then reveals the answer by coloring the cell red. If he had brought his own calculator to class, we would have all done 10 times better. He also got really condescending. I would not recommend.
This is one of the best professors I have had in KSU, he is super helpful if he can see you are giving it your best. He gives great study guides for the tests.
Fair but boring classes - teaches from power points.

The class was pretty easy because he provided the exam questions among other non-exam questions before the tests, as well as allowing students to make a double-sided help sheet to use on test day. There are also a handful of reasonable assignments/projects. Lectures were rather mundane and attendance is mandatory. Good for CPA exam. I got an A.

Sadeckas  is a fair guy. I had and have no interest in accounting but I managed to keep a B on the border of an A. He uses the Homework Manager and its worth a small chunk of your overall grade. If 75% of the class miss a problem he gives you those points. Overall he's a good professor, but sometimes he does go to fast through the power points.

Sadeckas is a new hire, and does a decent job at administering the class. The class itself can be difficult at times, but he helped a lot with extra credit and working the numbers to help us out. Nice guy, but sometimes it seems liek he's unapproachable. Could improve his response time to e-mails. I would take him again. 5/10

Ken is a nice guy who does his best to teach the material. He's knowledgeable about budgeting, but has some trouble with other aspects of the class. A little more experience and he'll be good to go. Class wasn't too hard if you study.
